==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|gloss=-}}

===Glyph origin===
An enclosed ({{zh-l|*囗}}) representation of the idiom {{zh-l|四方八面|[[all around]]; in [[all]] [[direction]]s}}.

===Etymology===
From {{der|zh|mn|ᠬᠦᠷᠢᠶ᠎ᠡ||enclosure; area}}, whence Khalkha {{cog|mn|хүрээ}}. Hence a variant of {{zh-l|庫倫|''used in placenames''}}.

Alternatively, as a {{w|zh:分音詞|disyllabic Jin derivative}} of {{och-l|圈|circle}} which has preserved the ''-l-'' infix in Old Chinese ({{zh-ref|Qiao, 2008}}).
